title: Analysis from graph of piecewise derivative part - c

content.description: The graph of the continuous function g, the derivative of the function f, is shown above. The function g is piecewise linear for -5 ≤ x < 3, and g(x) = 2(x - 4)2 for 3 ≤ x ≤ 6.
content.question: For -5 < x < 6, on what open intervals, if any, is the graph of f both increasing and concave up? Give a reason for your answer.

frqParts.text: For -5 < x < 6, on what open intervals, if any, is the graph of f both increasing and concave up? Give a reason for your answer.

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
